words.definition: A benefit is a good thing.
words.example: Being able to fly is a good benefit to birds.

words.definition: If you are certain about something, you know it is true.
words.example: I am certain that zebras have stripes.

words.definition: A chance is an opportunity to do something.
words.example: I had a chance to see the Roman Coliseum last summer.

words.definition: An effect is a change made by something else.
words.example: The medicine had a good effect on the boy.

words.definition: If something is essential, it is very important and necessary.
words.example: It is essential to have oxygen when you scuba dive.

words.definition: If something is far, it is not close.
words.example: Itâ€™s far going from the east coast to the west coast of America.

words.definition: To focus on something is to think about it and pay attention to it.
words.example: My mom always helps me to focus on my school work.

words.definition: The function of something is what it does.
words.example: The function of a flashlight is to help you see in the dark.

words.definition: Grass is the green leaves that cover the ground.
words.example: The grass looked so soft and green.

words.definition: To guard something is to take care of it.
words.example: The police officer will guard us from any harm.

words.definition: The image of something is a picture of it.
words.example: The image of her eye was very clear.

words.definition: An immediate response is one that happens very quickly.
words.example: An immediate response to the problem was needed.

words.definition: If something is primary, it is the most important thing.
words.example: His primary goal is to get a college degree.

words.definition: If someone is proud, they are happy about something they did.
words.example: She is proud of the picture she painted.

words.definition: To remain is to stay in one place or not change.
words.example: My dog remained in the house while I was gone.

words.definition: To rest is to stop being active while the body gets more energy.
words.example: I rested on the couch after work.

words.definition: If two things are separate, they are not together.
words.example: New York and Los Angeles are in two separate parts of America.

words.definition: A site is a place where something happens or is located.
words.example: We found the perfect site for our picnic.

words.definition: A tail is a part of an animal's body, sticking out from its back.
words.example: Our dog wags its tail when it's happy.

words.definition: Trouble is a problem or a difficult situation.
words.example: I have trouble with my homework.
